turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Artificial cell.
turn.1: What are the different applications of the Artificial cell?
turn.2: The most common method of preparation of artificial cells is through cell encapsulation.
turn.3: What are the different types of Artificial cells?
turn.4: Encapsulated cells are typically achieved through the generation of controlled-size droplets from a liquid cell suspension which are then rapidly solidified or gelated to provide added stability.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The stabilization may be achieved through a change in temperature or via material crosslinking.
turn.7: What are the different factors that affect the encapsulation?
turn.8: The microenvironment that a cell sees changes upon encapsulation.
turn.9: What are some of the changes the cell sees?
turn.10: It typically goes from being on a monolayer to a suspension in a polymer scaffold within a polymeric membrane.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is interesting?
turn.12: A drawback of the technique is that encapsulating a cell decreases its viability and ability to proliferate and differentiate.
